thread.title: Local golfers seeking MIAA state championships
thread.title_full: Local golfers seeking MIAA state championships

author:
Howard Herman
hherman@berkshireeagle.com @howardherman on Twitter
title: Local golfers seeking MIAA state championships
text:
Posted: 10/25/2015 11:12:48 PM EDT Updated: 10/25/2015 11:12:49 PM EDT 
The Lee golf team claimed a Western Massachusetts Division III championship a week ago today. Now the Wildcats will look to take the next step and possibly win a state title. 
The Wildcats and St. Joseph golfer Cody Tynan are at the Cummaquid Golf Club in Yarmouth Port on Cape Cod for the MIAA state Division III tournament. 
Three individuals — Nick Bator of Drury, Dylan Buffoni of Monument Mountain and Matt Wiseman of Mount Greylock — are in Bernardston for the Division II state championship at Crumpin Fox. 
Both tournaments begin at 9:30 a.m., and both begin with shotgun starts. 
The Wildcats had an impressive outing last week at The Ranch in Southwick, shooting a team total 345, beating Monson by eight strokes. 
Devyn Olds was co-medalist for the Wildcats, and was joined in the top 10 by freshman Thomas Frasier, who was seven strokes behind Olds' 78. 
Tynan qualified for the state tournament by shooting an 86. 
Lee's David Belanger will start from the first tee for the Wildcats. Bryce Whalen will also tee off from No. 1 with the second group. 
Hunter Roosa will start with a group at No. 6, Colin Finnegan will start at No. 9, Olds will go from No. 10 and Fraser will tee off with a second group from No. 18. St. Joe's Tynan will tee off at the 11th. 
Bator, Wiseman and Buffoni are three of the nine Division II golfers who have qualified as individuals. They will be in Bernardston along with Western Mass. Division II champion Cathedral and runner-up Belchertown. Advertisement 
Last year's state Division II champion, Wayland, did not qualify for this year's tournament. 
Weston, last year's Division III champion, looks to defend its championship. Contact Howard Herman at 413-496-6253.
